channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: AI's Practical Evolution In Manufacturing And Supply Chains: From Hype To High Returns
item.description: The convergence of AI's continuous learning capabilities with deep domain expertise promises to drive ongoing innovation and transformation.

item.title: What are you thinking about?
item.description: A philosopher can spend a month, a year or a career thinking about one knotty problem. Making assertions, testing theories, understanding how others are thinking about it as well. But this exercise shouldn’t be reserved for academics. What are you working on? When will you change your mind? What can you learn, what can you […]

item.title: Kamala Harris And The Climate Change Fight
item.description: In this week's Current Climate newsletter, Kamala Harris and the climate change fight; a big fundraise for electric robot tractors; and transitioning to a zero-carbon economy

item.title: “It seems…”
item.description: What a simple verb. A five-letter modifier that opens the door to discussion. If we state something as a fact, we’re asking for an argument. But seems opens the door to learning and discussion. What are you seeing that I’m not seeing?

item.title: Eliminating Unfair Power Structures To Foster Workplace Innovation
item.description: The workplace mafia is a group that dominates promotions, decision-making and the overall office environment through personal connections rather than merit.

item.title: The Zoom stretch
item.description: There are a lot of structural reasons why in-person meetings don’t involve a break every 12 minutes. It takes too long to stop and start. But those rules don’t apply to Zoom. Screens off! Stand up. We’ll be back in 60 seconds. If it’s not worth coming back, the meeting should have ended already. If […]

item.title: The Great AI Myth: These 3 Misconceptions Fuel It
item.description: The impending arrival of artificial general intelligence is a story of wish fulfillment that lacks concrete evidence.

item.title: Important change is systems change
item.description: Willpower is overrated. If you want to eat healthier, don’t work hard to avoid stopping at the cookie jar when you walk into the kitchen. Get rid of the cookie jar. Systems are long-lasting, widespread and resilient. We can push back on them with effort, but over time, the system usually comes out ahead. Once […]

item.title: What Will The Growing Adoption Of Weight Loss Drugs Mean For Customer Behavior?
item.description: From menus at restaurants and services at health centers to stock at grocery stores and even the locations of each, I believe we are heading for a period of change.

item.title: A bowl of rice
item.description: It’s expensive. Hundreds of people were involved in getting you that simple bowl of rice. It involved countless gallons of water, hours of labor, gallons of fuel. A complex supply chain that ensured you got what you needed, in perfect condition, just as you were ready for it. And it’s cheap. The amount of time […]
